description: In this series, we will explore the use of community code, or code written by others that to solve a particular problem or provide a particular functionality. We will explore how you can obtain these created solutions to increase your problem solving speed. In order to do so, we will explore the use of tools like pip, pipenv, and conda which are solutions to the fetching and managing of outside dependency requirements. If you are looking to solve bigger and bigger problems or just explore something of interest, then you will need help from others. Want to learn more? Join us as we dive in to the wonderful world of Python!

Join us as we dive in to the wonderful world of Python!
name: Using Community Code
subtitle: Do not reinvent the wheel..

episodes.description: In this series, we will explore the use of community code, or code written by others that to solve a particular problem or provide a particular functionality. We will explore how you can obtain these created solutions to increase your problem solving speed. In order to do so, we will explore the use of tools like pip, pipenv, and conda which are solutions to the fetching and managing of outside dependency requirements. If you are looking to solve bigger and bigger problems or just explore something of interest, then you will need help from others. Want to learn more? Join us as we dive in to the wonderful world of Python!
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.149 --> 00:00:05.807
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.807 --> 00:00:08.273
Hello, and thank you for
watching DevProTV.

3
00:00:08.273 --> 00:00:13.230
We're here to talk about using community
code with Mr. Justin Dennison.

4
00:00:13.230 --> 00:00:15.780
Now, Justin, can you tell us
what this course has to offer?

5
00:00:15.780 --> 00:00:17.110
>> So this course is about,

6
00:00:17.110 --> 00:00:20.820
well, the reaching out to the community,
seeing what has already been made so

7
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:22.770
you don't have to reinvent the wheel.

8
00:00:22.770 --> 00:00:27.160
And most of this time is gonna spend
around the tooling, because, well,

9
00:00:27.160 --> 00:00:30.110
the community is vast, it's expansive.

10
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:35.080
We can't take all the time to see every
little library module or package.

11
00:00:35.080 --> 00:00:38.270
So it's about using the tooling to acquire

12
00:00:38.270 --> 00:00:41.470
that community code to solve
problems that you may have so

13
00:00:41.470 --> 00:00:44.100
you don't have to build it from scratch.
>> Now

14
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:47.245
who should be watching this course?
>> So this course is aimed at

15
00:00:47.245 --> 00:00:49.907
someone who's, you've been playing
around with Python a little bit,

16
00:00:49.907 --> 00:00:51.820
you've been learning how to program.

17
00:00:51.820 --> 00:00:54.310
You're decently versed
in the standard library.

18
00:00:54.310 --> 00:00:56.700
You don't have to know everything,
the standard library is giant.

19
00:00:57.770 --> 00:01:02.770
But now you're like, well, I need to
really do x, I need to maybe plot a graph.

20
00:01:02.770 --> 00:01:07.788
Or, I really wanna build a web server,
or, I really want to just,

21
00:01:07.788 --> 00:01:10.300
I wanna do x or y or z, right?

22
00:01:10.300 --> 00:01:12.960
Something new that you can't
find in the standard library and

23
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:14.620
seems like a very large undertaking.

24
00:01:15.710 --> 00:01:19.240
Or, you're like, well, I wanna do x but

25
00:01:19.240 --> 00:01:22.170
in order to do that I have to
be able to read CSVs easily.

26
00:01:23.250 --> 00:01:26.390
Well, I don't wanna do
the whole CSV thing by myself.

27
00:01:26.390 --> 00:01:29.850
I wonder if there's somewhere in
the community that already has that

28
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:31.290
taken care of for me.

29
00:01:31.290 --> 00:01:33.750
And then you go, yeah, there it is.

30
00:01:33.750 --> 00:01:38.120
And now you can utilize that to further
your own project without having to

31
00:01:39.210 --> 00:01:42.150
continue to build everything
from absolute ground up.

32
00:01:42.150 --> 00:01:44.190
>> Is this a certification-based course?

33
00:01:44.190 --> 00:01:45.160
>> It is not a certification.

34
00:01:45.160 --> 00:01:47.260
It's more about powering up your skills.

35
00:01:47.260 --> 00:01:54.370
About seeing how working together as
a community throughout this Python and

36
00:01:54.370 --> 00:01:58.190
the feel, a lot of times other programming
languages have similar communities.

37
00:01:58.190 --> 00:02:01.190
And seeing, well,
can I take what maybe Aubri has done or

38
00:02:01.190 --> 00:02:06.910
someone else has done and build upon that
to power up my own understanding and

39
00:02:06.910 --> 00:02:10.380
programming skills.
>> What topics are we gonna cover in these

40
00:02:10.380 --> 00:02:12.950
up coming episodes?
>> So more specifically, we're going to be

41
00:02:12.950 --> 00:02:18.790
talking about how to use pip and how to
look at PyPi the Python Package Index.

42
00:02:18.790 --> 00:02:22.930
To search out for certain packages
that solve a particular problem.

43
00:02:22.930 --> 00:02:28.040
Some of these are small like,
hey where can I find URLs for cat images?

44
00:02:28.040 --> 00:02:32.660
Well that might be on PyPi or
it might be something more expansive where

45
00:02:32.660 --> 00:02:37.426
you're like, hey I need to figure out how
to communicate between multiple computers.

46
00:02:37.426 --> 00:02:39.340
Is that on PyPi?

47
00:02:39.340 --> 00:02:40.790
So that's our first step.

48
00:02:40.790 --> 00:02:45.870
But then we take a look that
pip has some shortcomings,

49
00:02:45.870 --> 00:02:49.110
we gotta figure out how
to not mess things up.

50
00:02:49.110 --> 00:02:51.640
So we look into virtual environments.

51
00:02:51.640 --> 00:02:56.150
Virtual environments are a way to kind
of sandbox where you install these.

52
00:02:57.888 --> 00:03:02.000
Then we realize that virtual environments
still have a little bit of a headache.

53
00:03:02.000 --> 00:03:04.530
So we looked at a brand new
tool called pipenv, and

54
00:03:04.530 --> 00:03:09.620
it's kinda hard to say, that allows
us to track what we've installed and

55
00:03:09.620 --> 00:03:12.520
manage our virtual environments
in a little more intuitive way.

56
00:03:13.610 --> 00:03:19.320
And then as an added bonus, if you really
wanna get crazy with your python packages

57
00:03:19.320 --> 00:03:23.710
then there's another tool that is
more scientific data analyst bent,

58
00:03:23.710 --> 00:03:26.830
called Conda,
that we'll finish up the show with.

59
00:03:26.830 --> 00:03:29.740
It does the exact same thing as pipenv, or

60
00:03:29.740 --> 00:03:33.790
Virtual Environments, but
it manages a few other things for

61
00:03:33.790 --> 00:03:38.080
these very specialty libraries that are,
sometimes, hard to install.

62
00:03:38.080 --> 00:03:41.710
And, well when we take a look
at both on Mac OS and Linux.

63
00:03:41.710 --> 00:03:43.860
That's predominantly where we are but

64
00:03:43.860 --> 00:03:48.510
also take a little detour to how we get to
setup on Windows so you can follow along.

65
00:03:48.510 --> 00:03:50.480
So, those are the high level topics.

66
00:03:50.480 --> 00:03:53.680
We're pretty deep into a few of them.
>> Alright.

67
00:03:53.680 --> 00:03:54.610
Well, thank you, Justin.

68
00:03:54.610 --> 00:03:56.240
Thank you all for joining us.

69
00:03:56.240 --> 00:03:59.110
If using community code sounds like
something that you're interested in,

70
00:03:59.110 --> 00:04:01.120
be sure to watch every single episode.

71
00:04:01.120 --> 00:04:03.926
You'll become one step closer
to being a Python Pro.

72
00:04:03.926 --> 00:04:04.581
Thanks for watching.

73
00:04:04.581 --> 00:04:09.469
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss the what and the why of using code that is available in the Python community. Justin explores PYPI, a common source for Python libraries from the community. Additionally, Justin explores some popular Python libraries that solve some common problems as well as highlights the problems that using those libraries solve.
episodes.title: Community Code: What is that

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at installing pip. Justin discusses that while most of the time pip comes preinstalled, there are times that it is not. Justin demonstrates resources for installing pip if the system does not have pip already installed. Moreover, Justin demonstrates the updating process for pip.
episodes.title: Install pip

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore install system level Python packages using pip. Justin demonstrates that using system level packages can be handy for Python functionality that is needed everywhere but warns about issues that can crop up if you "pollute" the system packages too much.
episodes.title: Install System Packages

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the idea of a virtual environment as well as provide a reason behind needed to manage these. Justin takes small tour of multiple tools that allow for the creation of virtual environments, then demonstrates the preferred Python 3 way.
episodes.title: Virtual Environments: Create

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri discuss how to appropriately manage virtual environments to keep those environments from being haphazardly placed everywhere on your computer. Justin demonstrates using environments from a centralized location or keeping those environments local to the project.
episodes.title: Virtual Environment: Manage

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri demonstrate installing packages into virtual environments that are being managed in both the local and more centralized ways.
episodes.title: Virtual Environment: Install Packages

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri utilize virtual environments to use PIL to modify images to a thumbnail representation.
episodes.title: Project: Resizing Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri take a look at the pipenv tool that alleviates the pains with managing virtual environments. Justin installs pipenv and explores some of the options that are available for using pipenv.
episodes.title: Install pipenv

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri use pipenv to create virtual environments. Additionally, Justin demonstrates the creation of virtual environments with different python versions, if available, and looks at the Pipfile that is created for the project when using pipenv.
episodes.title: Create pipenv Environments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri expand on the creation of virtualenvs using pipenv by removing those virtualenv files. Additionally, Justin demonstrates the recreation of virtual environments utilizing the Pipfile contained in the project.
episodes.title: Manage pipenv Environments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri take a look at how to utilize pipenv environments with multiple projects. Justin demonstrates changing between multiple pipenv environments and how changes to each project can be tracked.
episodes.title: Use pipenv Environments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri take a look at using pipenv to create a project that will find all of the image links on a particular page. Justin further discusses the implications of utilizing this program on websites.
episodes.title: Project: Image Links on a Page

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri explore the Anaconda Python distribution which comes with conda as a way to manage environments. Justin discusses why the distribution exists as well as why problems the conda tool solves with respect to pip and pipenv.
episodes.title: Another one? Why conda?

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri install the conda tool using the miniconda installer, which keeps the installation relatively small. Justin additionally demonstrates how to change the environment variables to use the conda installation instead of the default Python installation.
episodes.title: Install conda

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri install the conda tool using the miniconda installer, which keeps the installation relatively small. Justin additionally demonstrates how to change the environment variables to use the conda installation instead of the default Python installation in the Windows environment.
episodes.title: Install conda: Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri create conda environments using the conda tool. Justin demonstrates the multiple settings that can be used when creating Python environments using the conda tool.
episodes.title: Create conda Environments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri dive a little deeper to understand how conda environments are tracked and how those environments can be removed if need be. Justin demonstrates how to output a file to track the environment as well as how to recreate an environment from the conda files.
episodes.title: Manage conda Environments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri continue exploring the conda tool for managing environments. Justin demonstrates how to export and reproduce environments using yaml files.
episodes.title: Manage conda Environments: Reproduce

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri utilize the conda tool to clone a common environment as a foundation for other environments.
episodes.title: Manage conda Environments: Clone

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri utilize conda to install pandas in order to explore population data for the world. Justin demonstrates using Python and conda to ascertain answers to questions that have great deal of data, but no way to explore or visualize.
episodes.title: Project: Analyze Population Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri demonstrate how to remove conda from OSX and Linux based systems.
episodes.title: Uninstall conda

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Aubri demonstrate how to remove conda from Windows systems.
episodes.title: Uninstall conda: Windows
